intro: Quinchamalium chilense var. parviflorum, commonly known as the Chilean quinchamalium, is a flowering plant native to southern Chile. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color, blooming in late spring. Its foliage consists of dark green, leathery leaves that are arranged in a compact, rounded shape. This species is adapted to grow in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
